elements.title: Central Synagogue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York City's Central Synagogue (pictured) has hosted churches and a mosque?

elements.title: Nxdia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Egyptian-Sudanese singer Nxdia took the "queer anthem" "She Likes a Boy" into the UK Singles Sales Chart?

elements.title: founded in Tashkent in 1920 or Kanpur in 1925 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there is a dispute within the Indian communist movement on whether the Communist Party of India was founded in Tashkent in 1920 or Kanpur in 1925?

elements.title: John Gould Stephenson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Gould Stephenson fought at the Battle of Gettysburg while serving as the librarian of Congress?

elements.title: its branch in Basel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Swiss Party of Labour expelled its branch in Basel in 1988 after tensions over an occupation movement in the city?

elements.title: Stacy Hollowell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that between 2006 and 2007, Stacy Hollowell worked for basketball teams in Qatar, China, Bahrain and Lithuania?

elements.title: scientists set the record for the longest observation of a total solar eclipse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on June 30, 1973, scientists set the record for the longest observation of a total solar eclipse, at 74 minutes of totality?

elements.title: Ellen Oliver (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that suffragette Ellen Oliver recognised "daughter of God" Mabel Barltrop as the spiritual child of prophet Joanna Southcott?

elements.title: their own building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a ring-tailed monkey named Jenny threw billiard balls down a flight of stairs to alert firefighters to a fire in their own building?
